comments.text:
User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.0; rv:2.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0
Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.0; rv:2.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0

When a new Firefox window is opened by me clicking on a link in a Firefox dialog boxes, such as the "About Firefox" dialog box, the "main UI zone" (from the URL bar and the tabls to the bottom of the screen, means everything excluding the orange "Firefox" dropdown menu) and the system buttons on the right, are rendered too high.
In normal case, I can usually see a small (vertical) space between the orange button and the URL bar. In this case, the URL bar is stuck to the orange button, what makes the tabs being rendered higher and slightly truncated.
The problem seems to occur only if the browser is full-windowed

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Ensure the browser is full-windowed
2. Ensure the new layout is used (with the orange button on the left)
3. Go to "Firefox", "Help", "About Firefox"
4. Click on any link (I use "License information")
5. The newly displayed Firefox window should have the problem
Actual Results:  
The UI rendering is incorrect, as described in the "Details" section

Expected Results:  
The UI rendering is the same as when the browser is launched "normally" (started by the user)
